titleStmt.title: A continuation of all the principall occurrences which hath happened to the Leaguers lying before Breda shewing into what great extreamity and necessity the armie of the Marquesse Spinola is likely to fall into for want of prouision and pay: for which causes he hath already lost aboue 12000 men. With a relation of the forces that are now a leauying vnder, and for the command of Count Mansfield, and the Duke of Brunswicke, by Collonell Smith, and Captaine Daniel de la Riue, with expectation to receiue the forces now dismist by the Kings of Denmarke and Sweden, intending to aduenture their fortunes once more together. ...

publicationStmt.publisher: By B. A[lsop] for Thomas Archer, and are to be solde at his shop in Popes head Alley, ouer against the signe of the Horse-shooe,

notesStmt.note: Identified as STC 3594 on UMI microfilm.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.

place.placeName: his shop in Popes head Alley, ouer against the signe of the Horse-shooe
